intro: Palicourea hondurensis, commonly known as Honduran palicourea, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. It is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. The species is of interest to botanists due to its potential medicinal properties and unique ecological adaptations.
